Speaker: man
Dialogue: I need your help with this.

Speaker: constable one
Dialogue: Constable Crane?  Ichabod Crane... is that you?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Yes, it is me.  But, not only me...  I found someone here...

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Just a moment... if I may.  It is possible this man was murdered.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: There are surgical ways of telling how he died... by the water in his lungs...

Speaker: high constable
Dialogue: He will be burned pursuant to statutes of health.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: I could determine if he were dead before he went into the Hudson.

Speaker: high constable
Dialogue: Must we again hear these heretical rantings?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: There is nothing heretical about science, sir.  The Chinese have written on it for hundreds of years... procedural study used to solve seemingly unsolvable crimes.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Our first night watch is adequate against fire and some violence, but if we were more often able to ensure justice, after the fact, then criminals would truly have something to fear from law enforcement.

Speaker: high constable
Dialogue: Have they nothing to fear presently?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Without disrespect, look around you.  We overflow.  As do our courts.

Speaker: high constable
Dialogue: And, with disrespect, Constable, if jails and courts overflow, it is testimony to success, not failure.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: But, how many innocents rot here? And, how many victims are buried without reprisal while guilty men roam our streets?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Even though I have seen confessions pried from the lips of the accused, often quite literally?

Speaker: high constable
Dialogue: For one who calls himself a Federalist, your mouth reeks of Republican liberalism.

Speaker: high constable
Dialogue: The elders of the Hollow have sent dispatches to me, requesting assistance, and now, just this very moment, I have chosen you.

Speaker: high constable
Dialogue: These "methods" of yours... there has been no practical application.

Speaker: high constable
Dialogue: Just so.  Granted.  And so you take your experimentations to Sleepy Hollow and catch the murderer who has tainted the place.  Bring him here to face our good justice. Will you do this for me?

Speaker: high constable
Dialogue: Excellent.  Then, you are excused till morning.

Speaker: high constable
Dialogue: Oh, and, Constable...  Do make certain that you meet with success.  Otherwise... perhaps you should not come back at all.

Speaker: blindfolded woman
Dialogue: This is such a silly game.

Speaker: brom
Dialogue: Be a sport and stop complaining.

Speaker: blindfolded woman
Dialogue: There, I have someone.  Am I finished?

Speaker: little girl
Dialogue: You have to tell who it is.

Speaker: blindfolded woman
Dialogue: I don't know.  Is it Brom Bones?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Excuse me, Miss...  They have a laugh at your expense.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: I... I am looking for Baltus Van Tassel.

Speaker: brom
Dialogue: We haven't heard your name yet, friend.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Well, unless your name is Baltus, you should not worry over mine.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: I have been sent from the city with a letter of introduction. I am told you offer me room and board.

Speaker: baltus
Dialogue: This is not a time for frivolity, Katrina, is it?  Am I mistaken?

Speaker: baltus
Dialogue: That will be all, ladies.  We are joined by Doctor Thomas Lancaster, Constable.  And to his left are, Clergyman Steenwyck and our able magistrate, Samuel Philipse, both keeping order in their own ways.

Speaker: baltus
Dialogue: I myself am in charge of financial matters and the regulation of currency in our commonwealth.  And, lastly, this fine fellow is James Hardenbrook, our Notary.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: An honor, gentlemen.  In time I will need every detail of the three murderings you've had, but, for now, I ask only if you have any theory at all as to who the killer might be?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: I say, is there any one person suspect in these acts?

Speaker: philipse
Dialogue: Well, Constable... are you aware... to be honest, you are not what we expected.  We sent for the militia.

Speaker: father steenwyck
Dialogue: Why not tell us what you have heard? Hmm?  How much have your superiors bothered to tell you?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: All I know is three are slain, their heads found severed from their bodies...

Speaker: father steenwyck
Dialogue: The heads were not found severed. The heads were not found at all.

Speaker: hardenbrook
Dialogue: Taken.  Taken by the Headless Horseman.  Taken back to hell.

Speaker: baltus
Dialogue: You have not been well informed of our troubles, sir.  If you would...

Speaker: baltus
Dialogue: The Horseman... he was a Hessian mercenary, sent to our shores by German princes to help keep Americans under the thumb of England.  However, unlike his compatriots who came as muscle in trade for currency, he came willingly.  For love of carnage.

Speaker: philipse
Dialogue: Cut off his head with his own sword. It's a legend told for twenty years.

Speaker: baltus
Dialogue: But, only recently has the Headless Hessian been seen prowling the Hollow, in search of a head to suit his shoulders.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Just a moment...  Are you saying it is he?

Speaker: hardenbrook
Dialogue: When a goblin leaps from the nether world, others follow.  Poltergeists of the air, water and earth follow and cheer his desecrations!

Speaker: doctor lancaster
Dialogue: No one knows why he chose to now to climb out from his grave.

Speaker: father steenwyck
Dialogue: It is very clear why.  Citizens here have long tried to hide sins behind closed doors.  Their failed faith has saturated the soil and called forth one of Satan's own.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Excuse me, gentlemen, but... who has seen this Horseman?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Then, name one person who has seen him with their own eyes.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: While I will do everything I can to find your assassin, I will look for a man of flesh and blood.  Not some goblin-demon from hell.

Speaker: philipse
Dialogue: Gather round!  Gather and quiet! The hour has come to choose for this night.  Each man's name is in this box and has been checked.

Speaker: philipse
Dialogue: May the Lord watch over him...  "Jonathan Masbath."  Are you here?

Speaker: young masbath
Dialogue: No, father.  Wait...  He's already been up once.  Why does he go again?

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: It is a lottery, son.  It just as easily might have been one of them.

Speaker: jonathan
Dialogue: No.  You obey my wishes.  Brom.  Look after him, will you?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: You worry for naught, little man. Nothing will harm him there.  It is problems here on the ground you people need begin to worry about.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: Did they tell?  It is something in the air so that dreams come to everyone.  According to the elders, an Indian prophet held powwows here before the land was taken, and spells cast then still linger to this day.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Do you often make a habit of sitting on strange men's beds?

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: You are horribly old-fashioned, aren't you?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Feel free to form your own opinion.  Though it appears you already have.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: Well, I intended to apologize for the behavior of my friend Brom Van Brunt, but it seems I've made matters worse.  I'll leave you to your business.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Excuse me... I should apologize.  I, um... I... have no great love of...

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: It might have been more.  Might have been positively grand talk.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: Is it me, or are you this nervous around all women?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Perhaps it is because your suitor's hands were recently very nearly wrapped around my throat.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: The massive fellow... Brom.  For someone you call "friend," he misplaces a good portion of jealousy.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: He has proposed to me twice.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Which may explain his temperament. To have asked twice means the answer was "no" at least once.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: I've read a great deal about your New York City.  Do be a dear and tell me all about it.  Sounds like an extraordinary place to live a life.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Extra ordinary, yes.  But first, you tell me about the Headless Horseman.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: Not all think it is the Horseman. Many say witches come from the Western Woods to steal skulls for their cauldrons.  Some believe a person in this very town kneels before Lucifer, offering death as tribute.  And, still others believe none of it.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: To call a person superstitious is to imply they fear magic, but not all magic is black.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: There is no such thing as magic.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: Really?  Then... what is your rebuttal to those romantic poets claiming proof of magic in a rose at full bloom, or even in a teardrop?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Poets have silly notions about plants and bodily secretions.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: The Van Garretts died first; a man and his son, survived by a wife and two infants.  And the Widow Windsor was next...

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Why would he flee this direction, with so much open ground to cross before he reached cover?

Speaker: philipse
Dialogue: He would not have gone into the Western Woods.  No sane man would.

Speaker: philipse
Dialogue: ... found the body this morning.  You do believe now, don't you?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: You are the blacksmith.  Ever shod a horse with a hoof this large?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Young Masbath, I am sorry for your loss.  It is a great and sad tragedy. However... I cannot be the one to look after you now.

Speaker: young masbath
Dialogue: I did not ask you to, did I?

Speaker: doctor lancaster
Dialogue: The Lenape.  He comes to gawk at civilization from time to time.

Speaker: father steenwyck
Dialogue: Your superiors are two days away!

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Why was I not told of this?

Speaker: father steenwyck
Dialogue: The devil sent you, Ichabod Crane. The Lord will not forgive your sins.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: You made this, and the drawings?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Very well.  But, it will only sit gathering dust.

Speaker: philipse
Dialogue: Because of the Horseman, our migrant workers flee for their lives.  There is a danger that our crops will rot. So, if you are going to help us, you stop the Horseman.  That is your task... to kill an undead thing.

Speaker: philipse
Dialogue: Oh my... oh my oh my oh my...

Speaker: third man
Dialogue: You are certain it was she?

Speaker: freakish woman
Dialogue: In the lighting, I did see her.  Her.  Lady Crane...

Speaker: freakish woman
Dialogue: I will never forget.  The next moment, I found my infant dead... with the blood welt on his breast.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: If these are the random stalkings of a monster, what good am I?

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: People have put their trust in you.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: Won't they still have that justice?  Or, was it a vain promise?

Speaker: brom
Dialogue: The men who did this have been taken. We do not need you here.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: The Lenape Indian had much to tell once I opened his mouth.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: His teeth.  Someone had cut them and chipped off rotten pieces far back in his mouth.  The Lenape could not have done that for himself.  Someone out there cared for him.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Out there.  What do you see?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Yes... I suppose it is.  Keep it.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Now, hold the bowl steady.  Back to business.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: Why would you do such a thing?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: If it had been surgery on a living person, done to save that person's life, you would not question it.  Not for a moment.  So, let me be the first to tell you, dear girl... on the other side of these sheltering mountains, a whole world has advanced beyond such plebeian thinking as yours.  And someday, no matter how much you fear it, that world will come to roust Sleepy Hollow out of its slumber.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Pardon.  You did not answer when I knocked.  Are we intruding?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: The Lenape who lived in these woods... do you know him?  The Redman?  I should tell you... he has been murdered.

Speaker: old crone
Dialogue: Leave me.  You are not welcome here.

Speaker: young masbath
Dialogue: Were you a friend to the Indian?  You should have this... if you were his friend.

Speaker: old crone
Dialogue: You seek remedy against the Horseman?

Speaker: old crone
Dialogue: I hear him.  He rides to the Hollow and back.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: The wound is neither smooth nor cauterized, but jagged.  She bleeds like a fountain.

Speaker: father steenwyck
Dialogue: Let her burn!  Let her burn!

Speaker: brom
Dialogue: I say... if the Horseman is solid enough to take the lives of our people, he's solid enough to feel this...

Speaker: father
Dialogue: Nothing can be done against them.

Speaker: young ichabod
Dialogue: She was with me that night.

Speaker: third man
Dialogue: You do not want to be here.  Go home to your father.

Speaker: young ichabod
Dialogue: She did not do it... please listen...

Speaker: young ichabod
Dialogue: No, sir, please... she is innocent...

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Allow me some time.  I have spent every hour in the company of others. I need to be alone.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: The things I said to you before... I was wrong to say them.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: No, actually, you were not.  Every word you spoke had truth in it.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Do you know... I think those are the first words I have heard from you my entire time here.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: I apologize if I worried you.

Speaker: young masbath
Dialogue: You were right... it does draw attention to itself.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: His next victim is chosen!  Give me distance, then guide her back to the Hollow.

Speaker: beth
Dialogue: No one knows better than I.

Speaker: brom
Dialogue: Go to the front and guide it.

Speaker: brom
Dialogue: Let's see him catch us now.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: Lay still, Ichabod.  Do not move.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: I'm drawing bad blood from the wound.

Speaker: doctor lancaster
Dialogue: Keep still, Constable.  You were half-drowned when they found you.

Speaker: doctor lancaster
Dialogue: He is dead.  You would be also, if your wound had not somehow shut.

Speaker: young masbath
Dialogue: Someone left last night.  Looked like they headed to the square, but I lost them in the forest.

Speaker: young masbath
Dialogue: If someone has the Horseman's skull... if they control the Horseman, then why haven't they sent him for your head yet?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Do you have these persons' wills?

Speaker: hardenbrook
Dialogue: I have everything... last testaments... birth certificates, death certificates... deeds.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Yes, sir... but, do you have these?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: May I see them, Master Hardenbrook?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: May we look at them now?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: And it now belongs to you, according to Baltus.  I heard him say it.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: There are none for Magistrate Philipse either.  "Paasch, James" "Pieter, Thomas" "Pos, William."

Speaker: young masbath
Dialogue: I was getting worried.  Who was it?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Very little.  I must be going...

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: It appears well.  It has already clotted.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: It is fine.  Now, I must...

Speaker: baltus
Dialogue: He came to me.  He promised great violence.  Said I should cast you out for my own protection.  I must speak honestly.  There is no reason to think he will not meet with success.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: I have been reading your journal. I'm sorry.  I found it too fascinating to resist.  I rode to catch up with you at the Notary, out of curiosity.  Before I found you though, I overheard what you were said.

Speaker: katrina
Dialogue: If you think I am behind this, say it.

Speaker: young masbath
Dialogue: She's the one who controlled the Horseman, isn't she, sir?  Sir?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: I am sorry.  Forgive me.  I failed you.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Van Ripper, turn the coach about!

Speaker: doctor lancaster
Dialogue: ... help yourself, you pompous ass. I will be in bed.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Would you stay, doctor?  I may need assistance.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Jagged flesh.  The Horseman did not do this.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Here, Doctor.  Hold this just so...

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Open the door.  Open up, damn it!  Lady van Tassel is alive.  The Horseman is her puppet.  Please...

Speaker: huge farmer
Dialogue: She's dead, and you have gone mad.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Van Ripper... do you have a gun?

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: We might make it to the church.

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Damn it, boy, get back here!

Speaker: ichabod
Dialogue: Masbath is right.  We must do something.
